ygData.subject: RE: L46 weapon effectiveness.
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmm the parser I use has the ability to attach logfiles to a character for processing.  It appends them together to keep a full record unless you delete them
ygData.messageBody:
Hmm the parser I use has the ability to attach logfiles to a character for
processing. It appends them together to keep a full record unless you
delete them after processing. This parser has some interesting abilities
but they don;t seem to work properly for bards. The two I use are
Eqcharinfo and eqparser I think, but I don't remember offhand which is
which.

Shows how much I pay attention. I forgot the number appears in the line
when you are informed of skill increases. One of these parsers also keeps
track of every item you ever get a price on from a vendor. I found that
useful for seeing where I get the best prices.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Thursday, February 17, 2000 2:21 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] L46 weapon effectiveness.


From: <kim@...>

On Thu, 17 Feb 2000, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
>
> When you set up the parser (assuming it is the one I use) you assigned a
> character and set him up. Obviously it reads your inventory screen info
and

Nope, no setup.

> skill info somehow as it knows that 1 HS +1 raised the skill to 99 for
> example. I assume it picks up the other info on level and race the same
> way, from the other screens.

That's pretty easy - the server spits out a line that says
"You have become better at 1 handed slashing (99)" that's
recorded in the logfile.

Does anyone have a link to different parsers? Maybe there's
one that'll same me some of the work I'm doing.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
